speaker.whotheyare: Sean Davis studies the climate impacts from human-caused changes of the chemical composition of the atmosphere.
speaker.whylisten: Sean Davis studies long-term change in the chemical composition and circulation of the stratosphere, with an emphasis on human-caused perturbations to the Earth’s protective ozone layer and their impact on climate at the surface. He is a research scientist at the University of Colorado's Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Sciences and the NOAA Earth System Research Laboratory’s Chemical Sciences Division.
